benchmark_details.name: LogicVista
benchmark_details.overview: LogicVista is an evaluation benchmark that assesses the integrated logical reasoning capabilities of multimodal large language models (MLLMs) in visual contexts, covering five logical reasoning tasks across nine reasoning capabilities using a sample of 448 multiple-choice questions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate multimodal large language models on their logical reasoning capabilities across a variety of tasks.

data.source: Sampled from proprietary and licensed intelligence test sources to prevent data leakage.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by experts and validated through quality checks.

methodology.calculation: Scores are calculated based on correct responses divided by total attempts, expressed as a percentage.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better reasoning capabilities, while lower scores reflect challenges in logical reasoning tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Results provide a comparison against random guessing and other benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Comprehensive evaluation of model reasoning capabilities across defined logical skills.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data collected under licensed access, ensuring it is not freely available.
